projectPurpose: To provide an alternative C99 compiler for x86_64, implemented in Rust from scratch, potentially serving as an educational tool or a base for further development.
mainFeatures: Built from scratch (does not rely on existing compiler infrastructure)

alternatives.name: GNU Compiler Collection (GCC)
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU General Public License (GPLv3+ with GCC Runtime Library Exception)
mainFeatures: Supports multiple programming languages (C, C++, etc.)

alternatives.name: Clang
alternatives.license: Open Source - Apache 2.0 License with LLVM Exceptions
mainFeatures: Fast compilation speed and low memory use

alternatives.name: Tiny C Compiler (TCC)
alternatives.license: Open Source - GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPLv2.1)
mainFeatures: Very small size and memory footprint
Ability to compile and execute C source directly
Supports C89/C90 and much of C99

marketPositioning: wrecc is an open-source C99 compiler targeting the x86_64 architecture, uniquely implemented entirely in Rust from scratch. This ground-up approach, utilizing Rust's focus on memory safety and concurrency, distinguishes wrecc from established compilers like GCC and Clang, which are predominantly written in C and C++. By building a compiler without relying on existing large compiler infrastructures, wrecc serves as a valuable educational resource for understanding compiler principles and a demonstration of Rust's capabilities in systems programming. While currently focused on the C99 standard and a single architecture, its implementation in a modern, safe language provides a fresh perspective and a potentially more maintainable codebase for future development in the compiler landscape.
